creator: alps@ardaan.fsnet.co.uk
text:
Did a 2.0.46 to 2.0.47 upgrade on linux from source

In 2.0.46 the Apache manual uses type-map var files. Like index.html.var 
for the index page. You can see these in the apache2/manual directory. 
The manual was working great. 

After upgrading to 2.0.47 there are no var files in the apache2/manual 
directory. The index page is now called index.html instead of 
index.html.var. The contents of this index.html is not html it is the contents
of what should be the var file. The manual is broken:-(

until 2.0.46 there were no var files in the manual directory. We've used
multiviews. We *introduced* type-map files (extension: .html) in 2.0.47 and
changed the accomanying configuration. Please update the documentation
configuration (c&p from the distributed sample config) and everything is fine.

Thanks for using Apache.
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
I wan't to serve the apache2 docs from apache1.3. I tried copying the example 
config into my 1.3 config, but I got 2 problems. The first was that the example 
uses perl extensions in its regular expressions which 1.3 cannot handle. I 
solved this by modifying the regexes (see below). The second problem is that 
the server is returning "506 Variant Also Negotiates" when I try and 
access /manual. Why is this?

Here is the manual access part of my config...

#Alias /i/manual "/usr/share/doc/apache-2.0.47/manual"
# This would work, but the apache2 docs don't use MultiViews any more :-(
#AliasMatch ^/i/manual(?:/(?:de|en|fr|ja|ko|ru))?(/.*)?$ "/usr/share/doc/apache-
2.0.47/manual$1"
# Apache 1.3 cannot do the perl extension (?:pattern) in this regex, so turn it
# into a more old fashioned regex...
AliasMatch ^/i/manual(/(de|en|fr|ja|ko|ru))?(/.*)?$ "/usr/share/doc/apache-
2.0.47/manual$3"

<Directory "/usr/share/doc/apache-2.0.47/manual">
    Options Indexes
    AllowOverride None
    Order allow,deny
    Allow from 192.168.1.0/24
    # The above (+MultiViews) would work, but the apache2 docs don't use 
MultiViews any more :-(
    <Files *.html>
        SetHandler type-map
    </Files>
    SetEnvIf Request_URI ^/i/manual/de/ prefer-language=de
    SetEnvIf Request_URI ^/i/manual/en/ prefer-language=en
    SetEnvIf Request_URI ^/i/manual/fr/ prefer-language=fr
    SetEnvIf Request_URI ^/i/manual/ja/ prefer-language=ja
    SetEnvIf Request_URI ^/i/manual/ko/ prefer-language=ko
    SetEnvIf Request_URI ^/i/manual/ru/ prefer-language=ru
    #RedirectMatch 301 ^/i/manual(?:/(de|en|fr|ja|ko|ru)){2,}(/.*)?$ /i/manual/
$1$2
    # Apache 1.3 cannot do the perl extension (?:pattern) in this regex, so 
turn it
    # into a more old fashioned regex...
    RedirectMatch 301 ^/i/manual(/(de|en|fr|ja|ko|ru)){2,}(/.*)?$ /i/manual/$2$3
</Directory>
creator: chris@edesix.com
slive@apache.org
text:
Correct.  You can't server the 2.0 manual from 1.3.  There is, however, 
a plain version of the 2.0 manual that doesn't contain all the content-
negotiation complications.  This one should work fine from any web server.

See:
http://www.apache.org/dist/httpd/docs/
and grab the file that ends in .en.zip

Apart from the fact that prefer-language doesn't work in 1.3...

There is, however, the possibility to serve it using RewriteRules. If such a
configuration is of any interest, I could put it up somewhere (on docs-project?).
